reviewText: This was my first shop.  Brings back memories
great video took me back to my navy days

There is some things that they missed that would have been better.  I was there and the flight deck was a mess but they missed all the stuff that went on below decks.  I had to carry 28 bodies out of one compartment by myself because the rest on my team could not do it and I will not say anything bad about them, some can do it and others can not.  Darrell Dawson

I myself almost caused a fire when i was in the navy working on A-7E aircraft weapons. This fire was terrifying and made me shake while i watched it. Knowing i very well could have caused an exact same situation as the Forrestal fire. Navy rules are written in blood.... Corey
This is mostly just raw footage. I thought it would be more like Seconds From Disaster in other words more documentary.

Its not the same version of the movie that I got from you 9 years ago. It had LT McCain's A-4 plane that the rocket started the chain reaction on the flight deck. 50 men in my Squadron VF- 11 lost their ;lives in the fire.

I love this video because the man Gerald Farrier was my hometown.  I did my student teaching with his widow and learned so much from her.  It shows how he sacrificed his life to help the other men on the ship
